revised_title: Atomic Physics and the Strength of Metals: The Rutherford Memorial Lecture 1962
tldr: This lecture discusses the concept of dislocations and their role in the ductility and mechanical strength of metals. The author explains how dislocations can move and interact with each other, leading to work-hardening and increased strength in alloys. The lecture also explores the relationship between dislocations and impurities in metals, which can lock and unlock dislocations, affecting their movement and the overall strength of the material.
